FuncDef: The reset isis peer command resets the neighbor relationship with a specified IS-IS neighbor.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the system ID of an IS-IS neighbor.
-

Specifies the IS-IS process ID of the neighbor with which the neighbor relationship needs to be reset.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance. For the default VPN instance, this parameter is optional.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The reset isis peer command is used when a device needs to re-establish the neighbor relationship with a specified neighbor.
If process-id is not specified in the reset isis peer command, all IS-IS processes re-establish neighbor relationships with a specified neighbor.
This command is used to re-establish neighbor relationships with a specified neighbor, which may cause route flapping. Therefore, exercise caution when running this command.
